text: Flaska från Kvickly, Helsingör. Disig guldfärgad med ett vitt skum. Dofter av malt, frukt och citrus. Smakinslag av malt, citrus, karamell och frukt. Mjuk och behaglig munkänsla.

bottle (supermarket..). ambery light haze. caramel malty light harby autumny, piney nose. med bodied, quite smooth easily drinkable. good piney bitters, feels a bit old though, still well within bbe. just a bit bland, deteriorated flavours. but pine, caramels, herby leafy.
Guldfärgad klar med vit skum. Doftar och smakar lite citrus humle, karamellmalt och tyvärr lite grönsaker

Honningfarvet, rolig og ufiltreret English Pale Ale med mindre offwhite skumtop på 1-2 cm. 
Næsen rammes indledningsvis kun af lidt bondegård-aroma. Senere lidt frugt og noter fra havremalten. 
En halvfrisk, let syrlig, frugtagtig smag indledningsvis, som overtages af en middel sødme, og dernæst en kraftig, typisk engelsk, bitterhed, som ikke lige er mig smagsmæssigt. 
Øllet har en mellem fyldig krop og en middel karbonering. Bitterbesk og kort afslutning. 
Overall: Den engelske Pale Ale er ikke min personlige favorit, men jeg antager, at dette bud er et rimeligt forsøg i genren. Dog ikke Herslevs bedste øl. 
0.5 L, flaske, 5.9 % ABV, batch#1131, BB: 19/08/16, købt i Irma på Roskildevej i Valby. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
God og behagelis pale ale. Dejlig frisk smag. Tilpas med bitterhed. God smag af humle.
UPDATED: AUG 24, 2015 Tap carlsens. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of cabbage, butter, caramel, slight hops. Taste is cabbage, diactyl. Nasty. Clean your pipes!

Copenhagen 31/7 2015. 50 cl bottle from Irma. Very artistic label looking like a abstract drawing from the 1970ties. Pours hazy golden yellow with white head. Diminishes to thin layer of foam quickly. Lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma is fruity with bitter notes and some fermentation. Medium carbonation. Taste is fresh citrus and lemon - only a little sweetness - with a long bitter aftertaste with a dry finish. Pleasant summer pastime - if you manage to avoid the Shandys.

28-JUN-2015, bottle @home, from Irma.
Hazy orange/golden with lasting white head.
Very fruity aroma with grape fruit and orange.
Taste the same. Very bitter. This is close to an American Pale Ale and even close to an IPA. Alcohol can be felt. Malty sweetness accompanies the bitterness. Really nice drink.

Light hazy golden color with a fine white head. Rich aroma with notes of citrus, fruit and malt. Malty flavor with some grassy hops and fresh carbonation. Light citric. Nice pleasant mouthfeel.]Bottle from local grocery store in Copenhagen, Denmark]

Decent drinkable and refreshing brew. Quite light citrus hops, light fruity, bit corn. Moderate to light sweetness with moderate, quite dry finish. Decent, but I see no reason why I should choose this one over American pale ale
Normals, dzerams alus. Garas un smaras maz un neintersīvas. Smarzo pec kukuruzas un sausa rauga

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange beer with a decent amount of white head on top. Aroma is citrus, some yeasty esters, light fruit. Flavor has loads of orange in the base giving it a nice citric sweetness. Light bitterness in the back, decent amount of carbonation in the mouthfeel. Overall very decent and good drinkable.

Bottle. Pours hazy pale amber with a big creamy off-white head lasting until the last drop, and leaving a lot of lacing. Fruity hoppy aroma with oranges, some ripe fruits like peaches, grapes, muscatel, and a bit tropical; somewhat herbal too; light malt, some cookies and toffee. The taste is light sweet to dry and moderately bitter. Smooth creamy palate, with a long fruity aftertaste. Really nice and drinkable.
Decent, nice sure but not much happening except some bitterness.,,........ Bjjhv uttytt

From tap. Pours cloudy orange with a huge white head. Toasted malty, light herbal to grassy. Bitter. Toasted malty, biscuity and caramelish. Bitter and herbal. Dry far finish.Earlier Rating: 9/23/2007 Total Score: 3.350 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a huge slight off-white head. Mainly caramel sweet malt aroma with a slight orange fruity note beneath. Flavour is a bit opposite to the aroma, here the orange/grapefruit notes are by far more dominant than the malt base. Citric and slight acidic flavour, going into a rather dry bitter finish. Only a vague malt sweetness can be tasted.

Shared a 50cl from Danish Deli (Luxembourg). Pours a hazy orangish golden colour with a fluffy white head. Aroma is citrus, fruity and grassy. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is well balanced more bitter than sweet and dry finish. Overall, a very good beer.

Bottle from Irma Torvegade, CPH - slightly fuzzy golden/amber pour with small sized off-white head. Citrus hoppy, sweet grainy malts, grassy, slightly herbal, dry bitter finish, easy drinking for the abv. Decent enough.

Lively co2 propelled with a deep golden orenge colour showing a large frothy white head. Aromas of orange zest, citrus, light grass predominate supported by faint barnyard and leave aromas. At first the palate is hit by a lively fizz which fades quickly into a watery slickness. Offers a medium body with medium sweet, light dry, bitter flavours. The finish is coherent and medium long.

Flott utseende, gylden med medium høyt skum. Aroma av humle og malt, samt mildt fruktig. Den smaker hovedsakelig av humle og malt, muligens noe sitron og andre frukter. Syns jeg kjenner noe pepper i ettersmaken, sammen med en behagelig bitterhet fra humla. Medium konsistens.
At least in the suitable situation this was really fine and enjoyable pale ale. Well balanced and a bit unique I think.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Ar: grass, straw, hay, bread, minerals, earthy hops, almost pilsnerlike. 
Ap: hazy golden colour, medium very creamy white head, good amount of lacing. 
T: mid sweet, medium bitterness, some toffee, bread and earthy hops. 
P: medium body, soft carbonation, buttery and bitter finish. 
T: ok.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2014 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Slightly cloudy amber color, white head. Hoppy flavor with some citric notes, fairly dry finish. Medium-full body, medium-low carbonation. A bit too dry, but not bad

Edit: re-rated 8/2014. Seems much sweeter than previously. The balance is better.
@ Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget (50:-). Bärnstensfärgad. Ganska bitter, syrlig, fruktig smak, även grape, humle, citrus.
Bottle. A bit hazy amber beer with a big not lasting offwhite head. Fruity and hoppy aroma and flavour.
Clear golden of color with a white head. An aroma of citrus, hops, fresh and weak malt. A flavor of citrus, perfume, fresh, bitter and a weak dry finish.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Clear golden beer with a rich and quite lasting white head. Bready hop aroma, citrus, grapes, hay, yeast notes. Bready flavor, hay, caramel, some biscuits, grass and citrus. A bit dull to be honest.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2015 Fra fat på Aamanns(239.12): fin humlearoma og godt skum. Velsmakende og balansert, og med god humle-ettersmak. Forfriskende etter sykkeltur og perfekt til 2 smørrebrød! Flaske fra Irma Nørrebros runddel: stadig en velbalansert pale ale med en tilfredsstillende humleprofil (juli-15).

Backlog last year.
Golden color, ok foam.
Medium body & complexity.
Some hops, low intensity
Ok beer

Bottle from SB cons 2012-06-01 Göteborg
Ar: roasted malt, wee red fruits, bread
Ap: copper, high frothy creme beige head
F: full body, bread, malty, bread fruit, medium bittness, wee bubbly soft carbonation, citrus dryness
Pours amber with a beige head. Aroma is malt, grain and light hop. Flavour is malt, light peach and light flower.
Pours a hazy and copper beer with a white head. The aroma is malt, caramel and weak hops. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is sweetness. Overall a beer below average.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2012 Bottle.....Pours hazy dark golden with a medium white head.... The aroma is butter, hops, sweet and some fruits..... The flavor is hops, sweet, fresh, butter with a bitter finish...
One finger. Golden clear. Faint malty notes. Dust dry well balanced. Taste like a genuine ale. Hops flavours sparse.Very Classic.

Draught at Bartof. Hazy orange-golden with an extremely durable large and beautiful creamy off-white head. The nose is floral and fruity with orange, lemon, resin and mild caramel. Flavor is medium sweet and grassy bitter with citrusy notes, a lovely dry finish and a smooth viscosity in the mouth. Lively carbonation.

(50 cl bottle from Toft Vin) Pours a golden with medium white head. Decent lace. Aroma is malty with a hint of banana in there. Oily texture, medium carbonation, medium body and an astringent, bitter finish. Taste is grainy, moderately sweet with a certain acidity. Filling. Girlfriend says: "Its very light. Theres a slightly metallic taste to it. Its easy to drink."

Flaske 0,5l fra Vinmonopolet, bestillingsutvalget. Batch 456. Gyldenbrun. Litt tåkete. Høyt luftig skum som fester seg til glasset og varer.Veldig god sitrusaroma. Myk munnfølelse. Behagelig, dempet sitrussmak med innslag av aprikos & tørket frukt. Blir litt tørr & bitter etterhvert. Litt sedimenter i flaska. KI=5

0,5l bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours cloudy dark golden with a small white head. Aroma of sweet caramel and floral hops. Taste is fresh fruity, moderate hops. Medium bodied. Easy bitter end, refreshing and quite good beer.

29.01.2012. 0,5l Bottle. vinmonopolet.no. Hazy and unclear pale brown colour with white head. Lively carbonated for ae English pale ale. Aroma is malty with spruce hops. Medium tpo thin body gives a mouthfeel that is a little thin. Nice flavours of malt and bitter spicy spruce. Bitter aftertaste with notes of fresh green spruce shoots. Gets better the moore you drink and I think this is a very good ale.

Bottle from systembolaget. Pours cloudy, orange/brown, with small offwhite head. Big hoppy aroma of citrus, pine and grass. A steady body for a pale ale, citric pile bitterness, medium fruityness and newly cut grass. Farely bitter, fresh and rather dry. A fullbodied pale all, close to an IPA. Well balanced and well hopped. A really positive surprice from a brewery that have disappointed me most times so far.

050511: Good light pale ale with a slightly sweet taste. a lively beer with a fine dishwater like foam. The brewery writes that it is English in style, but there is used American Amarillo hops?.  Too much carbonation. Burp.

0.5 L bottle from Vinmonopolet. Two fingers of creamy blond foam on top. Body is near-clear deep yellow, with a golden glow. Clean malt aroma. Fairly dry, lightly toasted.  Nice smell of flowers and  mild spices from the hops. Taste  is balanced and hormonious.  Gently sweet, medium strong malt body. Lightly toasted, with a pleaseant sourish tone and a  note of barley grain. Properly hopped. Flowers and grass, faint apricot and earth tones. Also a fair amount of bittering. Healthy body. Slick in the mouth. Nice all over.

0.5l bottle. Pours a cloudy orangecopper body with a big creamy off-white head leaving big lacing down the glass. Aroma is really nice with strong notes of fruity hops. Also some citrus, pale malts and a light sour note in there as well. Really nice aroma for a pale ale. Medium-bodied, oily to watery mouthfeeling and average carbonated. Nice and malty flavors with some grassy hops, light hints of alcohol and it ends nicely with a mild watery finish, leaving a nice medium bitter and grassy aftertaste. Quite nice one.

Medium offwhite head. Clear pale amber body with carbonation. Fruity earthy toffee aroma with pea notes. Dry-sweetish earthy peas and grain taste with fruity spicy notes. Light body. Fizzy mouthfeel. Dry spicy herbal tropical fruit aftertaste with wooden earthy notes. Faint minerals, too. Interesting mix of the austere and the lushly tropical. (0.5l bottle, wine monopoly.)
Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Light bitter finish. Good balance. 270511

Hazy orange color,  small white head. Aroma has broccoli, vegetables, honey, wort and oatmeal. Very organic and full of flora. Some bread, malt, kitchen yeast and some hops in the back. Not very charming. Taste is dry with more sourness than bitterness. Maybe its just an old bottle.

Bottle. Hazy deep honey color, medium white head. Nose is pale malts, some uncanny canny hints (sorry, just had to :-P) and citrus. A bit strange, overall. Taste is pale malts, hints of citrus and grass. A bit low on flavor, and could also be fresher; despite a substantial grassy hop bitterness it still ends up feeling a bit too sweet. An OK pale ale, but vastly overrated and nothing that really tickles my pickle. Besides, the price is just ridiculous: 79 NOK (around 15 USD at current rates) for a mediocre 5,9 % APA is just lunacy, even for *Norwegian* standards... :-S Someone is making a lot of profit here; whether its the brewery or importer I dont know but since the profit margin for Vinmonopolet (the state-owned strong alcohol monopoly store chain in Norway) its not the last end of the chain, at least. Definitely wont buy again.
Quick-review: A nose dominated by citrus, caramell an a little acidic malt. A fruity flavour with a good caramellmalt in the back. A balanced bitternes, not very full bodied but a decent beer.

Pours golden with off white head. Malty aroma with some honey in the background. Light vegetables and some hops. A bit acid in the taste, light sourness, orange peel, hops, dryness and some weird yeast.

500 ml bottle. Hazy golden body with a fine, big, dense white head. Aroma has citric, caramel and malt and some acidity. Flavor is malt, caramel, fruit and balanced bitterness. All in all a well brewed and fine balanced beer. Nothing outstanding, but sometimes this is just what you need.
(Bottle 17/4-2011) Low head, but high CO2, a bit thin in the taste. 1 week after BB date.
Bottle.Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is fruity, citrus, peach and malt.Flavor is sweet malt orange , spruce and bitterness.Medium body, average carbonation.Nice Pale ale.

On tap at the grunnerløkka brygghus. Pours golden with a white foamy head. Nose is strong filled with some herbaceous notes, lemon rind, and even some buttery malty toastyness. Taste is similar with a great deal of tastey bitter intensitey. Fairly dry with a nice long hoppy finish. Really swell stuff.

(Draught at Lord Nelson) Poured golden and clear. Head was medium sized and white. Aroma was fruity and mildly citric. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitienss, citricness, malts, grain and bitterness. Aftertaste was fruity and bitter.
Copenhagen Beer Festival 2010 - Golden with a slight haze. Pineapple features in the hoppy aroma. Nicely balanced taste with pineapple, malt and a moderately bitter finish.
Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Good lacing. Aroma: hops, yeast, fruit, caramel. Taste: bitter, grapefruit. Good mouthfell. Pretty good beer.

Draught at Byens Kro, København, Denmark.
Hazy golden colour with small white head.
Fruits, yeast, caramel and mild hops in aroma.
Fruits, dry hops and yeast in flavour. Dry hoppy aftertaste.
Not bad at all.

Pours a quite hazy golden amber color with a thickish, frothy white head that diminished fairly quickly leaving traces of lace.  Aroma of toasty malts, chamomile tea bags (used), a bit o lemon and grass and an apple banana smoothie from five paces.  Flavor is predictable yet quite pleasant - toasty and grainy malts, nice floral and grassy notes, hints of clover honey on day-old baking powder biscuits.  Its a medium bodied ale with a gentle carbonated bite that rolls around the mouth and tongue easily and smoothly, like a languid lover lolling under the sheets nibbling teasingly on various appendages.  Not a great beer overall, but I have to say I enjoyed the images that it inspired in my descriptions.  Maybe its just being in Copenhagen...
Tap. Pale brown body. Almost no head. Relatively fresh hoppy aroma. A little hoppy flavour. Light bitter finish. (Lord Nelson, København, 10.07.09)

Golden with a small white head. Aroma of somewhat grainy malt. Sweet malty and caramel flavour with a weak fruity note, and chewy cereal (oats?) Probably lacks some yeast esters to be a truly impressive English ale.
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2011 Bottle. Clear golden with medium off-white head. Flavour is malt, caramel, bitter, fruit, dry and hops.

500 ml bottle, kindly brought home from Copenhagen by my wife. Brew #199, ABV is 5.9%. Hazy deep golden colour, huge white (slightly off-white?) head. Lovely fruity aroma of Amarillo hops, notes of citrus, hints of resin and tropical fruits.  The zesty flavour has distinct and fruity Amarillo hops from start to finish, on a decent malty background - well balanced. Not too sweet. Moderate but sufficient bitterness. A pleasant drop.

Bottle. Pours 
hazy golden with a creamy white head. Floral hops and sweet caramel. Vague fruityness and fine bitterness. Medium bodied. Would have liked the hops a little more aggressive and fruity. OK nevertheless!
Gold colored with little white head. Slightly hopped aroma with fruits and some yeast. Thin to medium bodied. Flavor is also rather thin with thin hops and lemon. Rather bland one.
Orsted Olbar, Copenhagen. Malty sweetness on the nose. Soft, easy palate. Ok but not great in all categories. Nice to quaff, nothing special.
On tap at EBF 08.  Cloudy orange gold, thin beige head.  Earthy aroma.  Good hop.  Quite tasty, but maybe doesn’t quite sing as it should.  Amarillos are quite restrained.  OK.

Bottled. Hazy orange golden colour with mediumsized white creamy head. Some lace. Aroma is mild fruits, some grass as well as mild notes of caramel and some sap. Flavour is fruity and quite wooden. Ends in a fruity and grassy bitterness. Pleasant.

Bottle @ SOPP, Helsinki. Hazy orangey golden, small white head. Fruity and well hopped, grassy nose. Similar balanced, fruity flavor, nothing exciting. Almost medium bodied, average mouthfeel. Clean and easy drinking bitter.

On tap during the Danish Champrionship in Trapez dinghy in Herslev. Orange-red colour with soft white creamy head. Characteristic aroma with hops and bitter fruits. Tste equals the aroma - nice bitter.
Bottled. Red, glowing body, small white head. Fruity, strong aroma, grapefruit and pineapple. Taste sweet with the hops eminent, medium finish.

Bottled
Hazy orange color, small steady creamy head. Amarillo hoppy, a bit yeasty and malty nose. Nice pale malty and citrusy hoppy. Good balance of hops and malts, nice session pale ale.

500ml bottle (SOPP2008, Helsinki)
Rich, slightly hazy orange. Hoppy urinal aroma, sweet and fruity - maybe it’s more urinal cake than urinal. Pleasant carbonation, rich full mouthfeel. Great malty body, and a huge bell-balanced hoppy thrust. A little sweet, but full of beery goodness. Really enjoyed this - what a hoppy pale ale should be like.
strong fruity aroma with some citrus. hazy golden with white head, flavor is refreshing pine , citrus peel, sugar. real good flavor - unlike some mikeller, the pine is not too dominant. great brew.

220ml on tap at Lord Nelson, downtown Copenhagen. Served at the right drinking temperature. Dark orange body. Great laceworks on the glass. Well hopped aroma with the smell of bitter citrus fruits. Flavour has also got a hoppy profile with in-depth hints of grapefruit shells. Smooth bitter ending and a very promising start to a drinking session at this cosy cellar pub (29.05.2008).
Hazy amber with large off white head.  Sweet fruity with caramel and hoppy notes. Ends bitter.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2009 First rating(50 cl bottle purchased in Denmark by my wife)BB 07.07.08 Bryg nr. 121On May 24, 2008Slight shady amber to copper color, small white head. Sweet, malty, grainy and slight hoppy scent, also dried fruits. Sweet and dry malty and bitter taste. Medium a bit spritzy mouthfeel, medium though perhaps a bit lower bitterness.6/2/6/3/12=2.9RerateDraught label marked 5.5% ABV, at Lord Nelson, Copenhagen, on July 10, 2009Clear pale golden color, no head. MAlty, sweet scent, some cheese. Malty and sugary taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.6/2/6/3/11=2.8
On tap at Lord Nelson. Hazy amber color, white head. Aroma is hoppy. Flavor is hoppy and fruity. Very drinkable.

The ale pours a vibrant reddish gold with a coarse white head. The nose is spicy, floral and slighty citric with a deep base of caramel and bisquit. Upon tasting, the lightly roasted malts join with a notable hop presence. At first, moderately sweet, medium body and well-carbonated. Then transitioning toward a nice balanced hoppiness toward the end.

0.5L bottle, shared with my brother who brought it from the source, thanks!  Hazy orange colour, nice creamy head. Perfumed aroma of orange, roses and some honey wax and flowery notes in the back. Good strong bitterness with just a little toasty notes in the back, medium body. Aftertaste is nicely bitter and a little sweet but just a little too dry, leaving an unpleasant dry sansation in your throat. Very good pale ale.

Aarhus, DK
Bottled
Very nice pale ale. The floral hops are balanced to the malty sweetness (Oats?)

Soft hoppy citrus aroma and some malt makes up the aroma. 
The flavour is nice and clean malty with a fantastic american hop flavour. Good bitterness and very drinkable.

Bottle, thanks to Jeppe for bringing this over to Belgium!  Clear blond body.  Off-white frothy head.  Aroma of amarillo, citrus, grass, hops, ... very refreshing and nice.  The aroma is not very complex, but fair.  Moderately bitter, lightly sweet flavour.  Decent bitterness is present, but not very outspoken.  It also becomes a bit annoying, it doesnt merge into the rest of the beer.  Ok, nice beer.

(Draught at Ölbaren, Copenhagen, 27 March 2008) Amber colour with creamy, off-white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with apricots, orange peel and floral hops. Fruity taste with apricots, caramel, orange marmalade and earthy hops in a lasting finish. Very nice one.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2015 Fad. Igen skuffende. Kunne ikke engang komme igennem en lille fad. Flot pilsnerfarve med en lille skumkrone. Duft af sur karklud, som en anden gæst beskrev det. Går igen i smagen hvilket fik mig til at tro at der var noget galt med faddet. Det var der ikke hvilket betyder at øllen simpelthen ikke var god. Ærgeligt fra et ellers godt bryggeri. 2,3
Rerate. Flaske. Helt anden øl. Gul frisk citrus og hyldeblomst. Meget lækker øl. Jeg er imponeret
Nice head and a beautiful red-golden and hazy beer. The aroma is hoppy and citrussy. The flavour is nicely balanced with a good bitterness, and I also find a bit of sour notes in the finish.

Bottle. Unclear light to medium amber color with a small, fizzy, virtually none lacing, fully diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, caramel, sour malt, light to moderate hoppy, citrus, fruity. Flavor is moderate sweet and light to moderate acidic with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. (211107)

Draught @ Bishops Arms, Malmö. Pours a dark amber color with a longlasting off-white head. Sweet malty hoppy aroma with some hints of citrus. Sweet malty and slightly hoppy flavor with some hints of citrus. Sweet malty finish with hints of hops in the aftertaste.

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense

Appearance:
Body: &nbsp Clear(1)->Murky(5) : 3 &nbsp  &nbsp  Pale Yellow(1)->Dark brown(5) : 3 &nbsp &nbsp Still(1)->Sparkling(5) : 3

Head: &nbsp None(1)->Large(5) : 3 &nbsp  White(1)->Tan(5) : 1 &nbsp  Lasting: 3 &nbsp Lacing : 3

Intensity : 3 &nbsp

Comments: A well-made caramel-malt oriented beer with soft breadiness and delicate toastiness. Not too aggressive in its hops, but the light citrus bite took me aback.
Tasted 2007-10-30. Bottle, 50cl. Pours hazy orange/toffee colured with white head. Light hoppy aroma. Flavour of hops, lemons and malt. Almost no bitterness. A bit weak, but good!
Bottel.50cl. Got it at the brewery. Small weak aroma but with a nice rocking head. It has a bit of acidity to it, good filling feel. bitter aftertaste.
Draught. Hazy amber. Aroma is fresh and flowery. Fine malt and a good bitterness in flavor. Pleasant.
Orange colour with medium head.Aroma is fruity with taste of peach and appel.Low carbonation and soft short finish.
Bottle. Amber colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of sweet malt, fruit, caramel and hops.

0.5 l bottle. Amber color. Sweet flowery-citrusy aroma with notes of honey and black currant. Dryer flavor with some caramel, honey, citrus and fairly strong black currant note. Very balanced and tasty.
Dusty, toasted malt nose, amber color, low tight head. Syrupy sweet malt, woody note. Light tight bitter. Nice, but not so thrilling. OK drinking beer. More of an American PA than a British one.

Bottle. Head was small, frothy and white which was mostly diminishing. Fair lacing. Color was slightly cloudy yellow. Aroma was pine, citrus, fruit, liquorish, caramel. Medium bodied with a light bitter flavor balanced with some sweet notes. Nice dry and crisp finish. Good Pale Ale!
Draught at Lord Nelson. Medium head with medium duration. Color is hazy golden. Nice strong hoppy taste and aroma.

Drught at Lord Nelson. Clear golden - small white head -> fast turning to white edges. Nice sweet malty, grass, pine, light caramel, citrus, grape, light berries - plus a bit taste of the olive i had 2,5 hours ago !!
Bottle. Amber with a nice white head. Aroma is hoppy and fruity. Flavour is freash and fruity, bit sweet, hoppy.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2007 <bottle tasted at home>
Interesting pale ale with a wonderfull citrus like aroma and a great flowery taste. An abit too fizzy sensation, but it helped to leave to beer in the glass for abit and wait for it buzz off. One of the better pale ales ive tasted.

[Tasted with svoger.]

First time I tasted this beer I  thought it was an IPA, because it has a nice and fresh hoppy flavor, so for me its an IPA and a  good one, indeed!

On tap at Ol Molevitten, Aarhus, August 2006.  Orangey colour. I thought this was more American than English in style. Theres classic resinous hop character in the aroma. A melange of citrus fruit - oranges and grapefruit - and tropicals dominate the palate but there are some earthy edges too and a firm malt base. Solid as a rock and very well brewed.
Draught. Orange with a nice, dense white head. Aroma of flowery meadows, lemon grass and a little malt. Flavour of oranges, fruit, meadow, citrus and flowers. Fresh and light.
Golden colour. Hoppy taste with some yeast . Very carbonated for the style nut overall quite nice.

Pours a slightly cloudy gold, with a very bubbly off white head. Soft aroma of apricot, grapefruit and yeast. The body is pretty unbalanced, with winey alcohol, horrible overcarbonation and a metallic bitterness. The finish is quite crisp, with some floral hops finally coming through, and also some caramel. Quite disappointing in all, any english hop  flavour was unable to be enjoyed because of the ridiculous carbonation.

(Draught at Bartof, Copenhagen) Pours hazy to clear amber with a white head. Smell: Spices and roses. Hops. pickled gherkin. Chanterelles in the background. Jam and sweet goosberrys. Taste: Hops and some butter. Warm and malty aftertaste with a really light afterbitterness. Salt and flowers.
Fluffy head on an orange colored brew. Fizzy carbonation. Light hops nose and taste- a bit orangey. Medium long lasting.
[Bottle] Hazy orange colour. Large firm head. Biscuit aroma with notes of orange zest. Tastes pretty much as it smells. Quite tasty, but the flavour is a little bit too short I think.
Bottle: Light amber with a beige head. Gentle spicy hops and simple caramalt. Quite tasty.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is hoppy . The flavour is hoppy with notes of sweet caramel. Weak bitter finish.

Pours slightly orange with good white head. Aroma is hoppy with tones of fruit - very nice. TAste is a bit of a let-down from the aroma. It has a slight bitterness to begin with that enhances with some spicyness in the end
On tap. Amber unclear colour with a weak head. Very light aroma of sweet malt. Fairly flavour of sweetness, caramel and ends up light and very dull. Reminds me of a bad homebrew.
Bottle. Golden with little head. Hops and also quite fruity - a bit bitter. Also a bit of lemon taste.

Perfumey, floral, fruity aroma evokes soapy lavender and a light spiciness.  Lightly hazy deep orange-tan coloured body is topped by a generous, fine bubbled, white head that recedes fairly quickly to a lasting cover with excellent lacing.  Hop flavours greet the tongue initially but are joined by toasty and biscuity malt character.  Bitterness is quite subdued but keeps the clean, sweet malts from being overwhelming.  Floral hops last in the aftertaste.  Effervescent, lively carbonation engages the mouth and keeps it feeling fresh.  Definitely more in the British tradition this is a decent and quaffable pale ale.  Cellar temperature.  Tulip glass.  Bottle (M.h.t. 29.09.05 / B92, Ølbutikken, Aug-05).

Bottle.  Trade with Chris_o.  A hazy orange coloured beer with an off-white head.  The aroma is nicely hoppy with spicy peppery notes and a lemony citrus feel.  Good body with nice bitter hops, in the UK fashion.  More spicy peppery character.  A really tasty beer.
Draught. Aroma has some fruitiness from aroma hops. Greyish copper colour. Very small head. Malty flavour, but with rough bitterness and rough carbonation.
Bottle. Longlasting white head. Light cobber. Yeast aroma.  Bitter hops taste.  Sorry mates not tutti fruti as claimed by others. Still: Well done.

Extremly beautiful beer - perfect!
Slightly bitter with a great aroma and fruity taste.

Cloudy dull amber colour with big head.  Perfumey, hoppy, flowery aroma.  The flavour shows more of that perfumey hoppiness, getting medicinal.  Light bitterness.  Malts are fairly faint and nondescript.
Draught. - Light orange colour. Light flowery nose. Fairly soft hoppy taste, with a bittersweet biscuity finish, and a strange, slightly metalic aftertaste.
Pours a slightly hazy amber with white head. Rather bitter end sour (in a good way) Floral aromas of hops and malt. Full bodied. Lots of CO2. Bitter/sour, hoppy finish.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2006 Bottle. This is my biggest suprise in a long time. This is a fantasic beer. Excellent mostly lasting head. Nice amber colour. Powerfull aroma. But the finish of this beer is amasing. Long and compleks. Creamy palate.
Golden orange colour and a white lacing and creamy head. Aroma of citrus and hops. Soft finish
Lovely pale ale from the bottle. Nice smell of yeasts and soft sweet tones. That refelcts the taste aswell. Very fresh citus flavours balanced by nice dry hoparomas.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2011 Bottle. Dark golden, hazy beer with  white head. Lots of citrus-aromas. Fizzy mouthfeel with lots of fruity sweet and citric tastes. Finishes with lots of aromahops. Rating: 8-3-8-4-16-3.9. 050923Bottle. Its a hazy, orangey golden beer with a big, white head. Some lacings too. Peachy nose with a touch of green pine cones ans some maltyness. Quite thin on the palate, medium bodied at least. Nice carbonation. Theres a nice bitterness in the flavor, both initially and in the end. Pale malts and flavors of green pine cones and some peaches. A nice beer indeed, but definitely not deserving my earlier 3.9 rating. Wouldnt mind having this accessible at my local. 110406

On draught, Nørrebro, Copenhagen. 
Dark orange. Citrusy hop nose. Citrusy, bit chewy with a proper hop bitterness. Very dry. It tasted like an American Pale Ale to me.

(Bottle 50 cl) Pretty, slightly hazy, amber coloured beer with a small, fine, creamy head. Very intense bitterness, but at the same time very crisp and aromatic. A bit low in carbonation, but an interesting debut from Herslev. 050504

Hazy orange colour, thick white head with serious lacing. Hoppy, citrus nose with some hints of toffee. Hoppy flavour as well with loads of diacetyl, and a refreshing citric hoppiness in finish. Rather full bodied. Great bitter finish. Sweet-ish palate.
Draught. Very hoppy, good firm bitterness and quite fullbodied. A very good pale ale.

Draft. Theres something almost peppery in the flavor. And its very bitter. In my opinion not the best either pale ale of Herslev product. But a pretty good thirst quencher. And of course, its far from bad.
Hazy light amber. Rich firm white head. Honey and floral hops in the aroma. Round aromatic flavour of oranges, kiwi, honey and flowers. Clean, hoppy and bit herbal aftertaste. Nice one.

Bottle
Low head, cloudy orange with some yeast floaties.
Fruit Yoghurt aroma.
Peachy and mangolike flavor.
Light body, a bit fizzly mouthfeel.
Tastes a lot like a a peach melba yoghurt - interesting.

Bottle, at No. 5.
Light, very clear. Aroma fruity, flavor hoppy. Very fine.

Amber colour with white head. Aroma of hops, aroma hops and pine needles.
Sweet fruity flavour with notes of malt, hops and pineneedles.
50cl bottle; Excellent aroma of hops. Hazy, Copper colored with beautyful puffy head. Taste is a bit sweet and fruity but with a salty aftertaste. Good mouthfeel, and carbonation.

Pours a darker orange/red, small white head. VERY carbonated. Aroma is yeasty, hay. Flavor is hops, bitter, and a little sourness to it. Bubbly and sweet finish. Thanks to DavidP for sharing this one.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2005 First of all, when this was opened it was a gusher, but may have seen a little too much heat. the body is a light reddish orange with almost no head. The nose was dirt, coffee and earthy undertones. The taste is surprisingly light and sweet. It has bread, nutmeg and a spicy black pepper finish. A nice decent balanced PA. Thanks to DavidP for sharing this unique brew.

Cloudy amber body with a thin white head.  Light, dry aroma with dry grass, light caramel and earth (thanks Eric).  Spicy, earthy flavor with a dry, grassy finish.  An appreciated spin on the pale ale style.  I should thank Ungstrup for leaving this bottle behind at the GABF RB party.

this beer was a gusher.
the appearance was cloudy w/ good carbonation bubbles and a thin light head that dissipated quickly. the aroma was of hopps and citurs, the palate was creamy a touch sweet and full of the carbonation sting.  The fliver was mildly bitter w/ hints of something earthy... I liked this beer but there was nothing incredibly impressive about it.
UPDATED: DEC 17, 2004 Hazy red amber colour. Grassy, acidicly hoppy aroma. The acidic hoppiness also dominates the flavour and the finish. I am not too impressed.

Clear copper with a thick white lacey head.  Aroma is dominated by European hops.  Semi-sweet, but mostly dry body has a crisp palate and is quite enjoyable.  Not much in the way of complexity or thickness, but a very drinkable English style pale ale.  Thanks to Ungstrup for bringing this to the GABF RateBeer tasting.

Dense particles, orange-copper color and a clean white head. Fruity, vegetal dry-hopped nose. Strangely, the aroma suggested tomatoes to me. Malty flavor with an odd cheese and fruit hoppy quality. I didnt care for this very much.

Poured a light copper color with a large white head that left no lacing.  Aroma of dry straw, wheat and light citrus hops.  Taste was slightly bitter hops, overall seemed to finish dry as well.  I would have liked a bit more fruitiness.
A nice pale ale. FIne malt and a good bitterness, not strong, but good. Yellow, medium head.
A nice pale ale. Quite bitter and hoppy but sweet malty finish. Great mouthfeel and appearance. Hard to believe it is a Danish beer, however, when you see the crazy price of this beer, it is obvious.
Cloudy dark golden with small head. Malty and delisciously hopped. A little herbal, earthy and with some liqourice fudge. Really nice.

Bottle. Like an English bitter, with a microbrewed feel, feels like theres more ingredients in here than your typical English bitter aswell. Quite malty to start (slightly burnt??), earthy flavour, some orange/citrusy hops in the finish. Bitter finish.

Bottled, thanks to Ungstrup and MartinKurbert  Really enjoyed this beer for its raw personality and difference. Foggy golden with a white foaming head. The farmyard aroma is as striking as it is interesting. Firmed hey and livestock. Lots of new and different flavours. Mouldy cheese, ripe and fermenting. Yum.
Cloudy orange, color, fruity malty aroma and taste, with a nice bitter taste, medium body, long bitter finish. a real good pale ale.
Deep golden color with a white head. The taste is sweet and malty. Has a slight hoppe bitterness on the palate.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2007 Bottled: Orange brown ale, tall white lasting head. The flavour starts fresh with clear notes of green apples. The rest is hops. A dry hopped finish. Watery palate. Overall good old style IPA.
Draugth: More underlying malty sweetness.
[Draught] Orange coloured. Pleasant hoppy aroma.  Very fruity and hoppy flavour. Bitter and grassy finish. Refreshing, but slightly thin.

hazy amber-orange colour, little foam, hoppy nose with notes of apricot and flowers, oily with a good malty body, robust bitterness, long hoppy, malty and slightly spicy finish - a nice pale ale with a good character - thanks to BierKönig for this one !

Tap, DBF 2004. Hazy amber gold, thin white head and low condition. Good solid Cascade? Hop aromas with some gentle honeyed malt notes in the nose. Hops are joined by a pleasantly balancing toffee maltiness in the mouth before a hoppy bitterness takes over in the finish.
KegCloudy orange color; creamy head. Nice hoppy aroma, with some fruitness and white pepper. Some good malty body, a bit thin; very strong and long bitterness.
Draught @ DBF 04.Unclear pale orange with small head. Lots of hops in aroma and flavor combined with a pleasant balanced bitterness. Nice aftertaste too. I really loved this one.

[Draft] A hazy orange beer with a small disappearing head. The aroma is very fruity and hoppy. The flavor is very fresh - with a very fresh hop flavor and lots of notes of oil and grass, and a fine bitterness. Except for the alcohol content this reminds me more of an IPA than a pale ale.
Orange colour with a creamy small head. Aroma hoppy and malty with some fruit. Flavor is fruity and citric, with a nice aftertaste.
Draught @ DBF2004: Orange coloured. Unclear. Beige dense head. Hops, malts and fruits in the aroma. Flowery and fruity flavour. Notes of hops. Has a long lingering and pleasant aftertaste.

Draught at DBF 2004. Hazy yello/pale body, creamy little head. Aroma is very fruity and citric from the hops. Nice malt presence in the flavor, fruity, hops to back the whole thing up. This one was rather nice!

Sampled draught at Dansk Ølfestival. 
Pale amber, cloudy. Fruity, grassy and lightly ashy. Sweet and hoppy, soft and flowery. Balanced bitter, hay-like finish. Very British.

(on tap) A very nice pale ale in these "all-we-need-is-a-nother-IPA-days".Small head and a foamy body to this deep orange brew. The malts comes through gently and just a twnikle of hops in the end. A really enjoyable beer.

Pours a foamy lasting white head on a hazy amber orange body. Aroma has strong notes of hops and fruit with undertones of caramel and some yeast. Nice and sweet. Flavor is bittersweet with a "home-brewed" touch. Sweet malty and bitter hoppy and yeasty. A really good beer and a nice surprise from a new brewery on the fast growing Danish beer scene!!
